info.name: OTU API v2
info.description: Complete API collection for the OTU Educational Management System. This collection includes endpoints for authentication, user management, course management, attendance tracking, exam management, fee management, and more. All endpoints require appropriate authentication tokens except for public routes.

item.name: Public
item.description: Public endpoints that don't require authentication. These endpoints are accessible to all users without authorization tokens.

item.name: Get Locations
item.description: Retrieve a list of all available campus locations and their details. This endpoint is public and can be accessed without authentication.

item.name: Authentication
item.description: Authentication endpoints for user login, registration, and session management. These endpoints handle user authentication and token management.

item.name: Login
item.description: Authenticate a user and receive an access token. Required fields: email, password, and device_name. Returns a bearer token for API access.

item.name: Register
item.description: Create a new user account. Required fields: name, email, password, password_confirmation, and device_name. Returns a bearer token upon successful registration.

item.name: Logout
item.description: Invalidate the current user's access token. Requires authentication token in the header.

item.name: Get Current User
item.description: Retrieve the authenticated user's profile information. Requires authentication token in the header.

item.name: Admin
item.description: Administrative endpoints for managing users, groups, courses, schedules, and system settings. These endpoints are restricted to users with admin privileges.

item.name: Users
item.description: User management endpoints for administrators. Includes functionality for creating, updating, and managing user accounts and roles.

item.name: List Users
item.description: Retrieve a paginated list of all users in the system. Can be filtered by role, status, and search terms.

item.name: Create User
item.description: Create a new user account with specified role and permissions. Required fields: name, email, password, and role.

item.name: Get User
item.description: Retrieve detailed information about a specific user by their ID.

item.name: Update User
item.description: Modify an existing user's information. Can update name, email, role, and other user details.

item.name: Delete User
item.description: Remove a user account from the system. This action cannot be undone.

item.name: Get Roles
item.description: Retrieve a list of all available user roles and their associated permissions.

item.name: Get User Groups
item.description: Retrieve a list of all user groups and their members.

item.name: List Students
item.description: Retrieve a paginated list of all students. Can be filtered by group, course, or status.

item.name: List Teachers
item.description: Retrieve a paginated list of all teachers. Can be filtered by department or subject area.

item.name: Groups
item.description: Manage student groups and class sections. Includes functionality for creating, updating, and managing group assignments.

item.name: List Groups
item.description: Retrieve a paginated list of all student groups. Can be filtered by academic year and semester.

item.name: Create Group
item.description: Create a new student group. Required fields: name, description. Optional: academic year, semester.

item.name: Get Group Students
item.description: Retrieve a list of all students assigned to a specific group. Returns detailed student information.

item.name: Courses
item.description: Manage course offerings and assignments. Includes functionality for managing course teachers and group assignments.

item.name: List Course Teachers
item.description: Retrieve a list of all teachers assigned to courses. Can be filtered by department or semester.

item.name: List Course Groups
item.description: Retrieve a list of all groups assigned to courses. Shows course-group relationships and schedules.

item.name: Schedules
item.description: Manage course schedules and timetables. Includes functionality for creating and managing class schedules, room assignments, and time slots.

item.name: List Schedules
item.description: Retrieve a list of all course schedules. Can be filtered by day, time slot, or room.

item.name: Create Schedule
item.description: Create a new course schedule. Required fields: course_id, group_id, day, start_time, end_time.

item.name: Get Schedule
item.description: Retrieve detailed information about a specific schedule by its ID.

item.name: Update Schedule
item.description: Modify an existing schedule's details. Can update day, time slots, and room assignments.

item.name: Delete Schedule
item.description: Remove a schedule from the system. This action cannot be undone.

item.name: Get Group Schedules
item.description: Retrieve all schedules for a specific group. Shows complete timetable for the group.

item.name: Get Course Schedules
item.description: Retrieve all schedules for a specific course. Shows all time slots and groups for the course.

item.name: Attendance
item.description: Manage attendance records for both teachers and students. Includes functionality for tracking and reporting attendance.

item.name: List Teacher Attendance
item.description: Retrieve attendance records for all teachers. Can be filtered by date range and status.

item.name: List Student Attendance
item.description: Retrieve attendance records for all students. Can be filtered by course, group, or date range.

item.name: Get Course Attendance Stats
item.description: Retrieve statistical attendance data for a specific course. Shows attendance percentages and patterns.

item.name: Student Notes
item.description: Manage academic and behavioral notes for students. Includes functionality for creating, updating, and tracking student records.

item.name: Add Note
item.description: Create a new note for a student. Required fields: note content and type (academic/behavioral/other).

item.name: Update Note
item.description: Modify an existing student note. Can update note content and type.

item.name: Delete Note
item.description: Remove a student note from the system. This action cannot be undone.

item.name: Grade Reports
item.description: Generate and manage academic grade reports. Includes functionality for creating and exporting various types of grade reports.

item.name: Export Course Report
item.description: Generate and download a detailed grade report for a specific course. Includes all student grades and statistics.

item.name: Export Student Report
item.description: Generate and download a comprehensive grade report for a specific student. Includes all courses and cumulative statistics.

item.name: Export Report
item.description: Generate and download a general academic report. Can be customized based on various parameters.

item.name: Delete Student Report
item.description: Remove a generated student report from the system. This action cannot be undone.

item.name: Teacher
item.description: Teacher-specific endpoints for managing courses, attendance, exams, and grades. These endpoints are restricted to users with teacher privileges.

item.name: Attendance
item.description: Manage student attendance records for courses. Includes functionality for recording and tracking attendance.

item.name: Record Attendance
item.description: Record attendance for students in a specific course. Required fields: course_id, date, and student attendance status.

item.name: Get Student Stats
item.description: Retrieve attendance statistics for a specific student. Shows attendance patterns and percentages.

item.name: Exams
item.description: Manage course examinations and assessments. Includes functionality for creating, grading, and managing exams.

item.name: Create Exam
item.description: Create a new exam for a course. Required fields: title, course_id, total_marks, duration, start_time, end_time.

item.name: Add Question
item.description: Add a question to an existing exam. Supports multiple question types including multiple choice and open-ended.

item.name: Grade Open Ended
item.description: Grade open-ended questions for a student's exam submission. Includes feedback and marks allocation.

item.name: Publish Exam
item.description: Make an exam visible to students. Exam must be complete with all questions before publishing.

item.name: Unpublish Exam
item.description: Hide an exam from students. Useful for making last-minute adjustments to published exams.

item.name: Open Exam
item.description: Make an exam available for students to take. Exam must be published before opening.

item.name: Close Exam
item.description: Close an exam to prevent further submissions. Can be reopened if needed.

item.name: Student Attendance
item.description: Bulk management of student attendance records. Includes functionality for recording attendance for multiple students.

item.name: Record Bulk Attendance
item.description: Record attendance for multiple students at once. Useful for quick attendance marking for entire classes.

item.name: Teacher Attendance
item.description: Manage teacher attendance records. Includes functionality for recording and tracking teacher presence.

item.name: List Attendance
item.description: View personal attendance history. Can be filtered by date range.

item.name: Record Attendance
item.description: Record personal attendance for a day. Required fields: date, status, and location_id.

item.name: Get Attendance
item.description: Retrieve details of a specific attendance record.

item.name: Update Attendance
item.description: Modify an existing attendance record. Can update status and reason.

item.name: Grades
item.description: Manage student grades and academic performance records. Includes functionality for recording and submitting grades.

item.name: Batch Update Course Grades
item.description: Update grades for multiple students in a course simultaneously.

item.name: Submit Final Grades
item.description: Submit final grades for a course. This action typically locks the grades for the term.

item.name: Export Course Grades
item.description: Generate and download a grade report for a specific course.

item.name: Student
item.description: Student-specific endpoints for accessing courses, exams, grades, and other academic information. These endpoints are restricted to users with student privileges.

item.name: Exams
item.description: Access and participate in course examinations. Includes functionality for taking exams and viewing results.

item.name: List Available Exams
item.description: View all available exams for enrolled courses. Shows upcoming and ongoing exams.

item.name: Submit Exam
item.description: Submit answers for an exam. Required fields: answers array with question_id and answer.

item.name: View Results
item.description: View results and feedback for a completed exam.

item.name: Fees
item.description: Manage student fees and payments. Includes functionality for viewing statements and processing payments.

item.name: View Statement
item.description: View current fee statement showing all charges and payments.

item.name: Create Payment
item.description: Initiate a new fee payment. Required fields: amount and payment_method.

item.name: Payment History
item.description: View history of all fee payments and transactions.

item.name: Process Payment
item.description: Complete a pending payment transaction.

item.name: Get Payment Receipt
item.description: Download receipt for a completed payment.

item.name: Payment Gateway
item.description: Access payment gateway for processing online payments.

item.name: Retry Payment
item.description: Retry a failed payment transaction.

item.name: Grades
item.description: Access academic grades and performance records.

item.name: Get Course Grades
item.description: View grades for a specific course including assignments and exams.

item.name: Schedules
item.description: Access class schedules and timetables.

item.name: List Schedules
item.description: View all class schedules for enrolled courses.

item.name: Get Schedule
item.description: View detailed information for a specific schedule.

item.name: Admin Requests
item.description: Manage administrative requests and applications.

item.name: Create Request
item.description: Submit a new administrative request. Required fields: type and details.

item.name: List Requests
item.description: View all submitted administrative requests and their status.

item.name: Update Request Status
item.description: Update the status of an administrative request.

item.name: Add Response
item.description: Add a response to an existing administrative request.

item.name: Attendance
item.description: Access personal attendance records.

item.name: List Attendance
item.description: View personal attendance history for all courses.

item.name: Get Attendance
item.description: View details of a specific attendance record.

item.name: Get Attendance Stats
item.description: View attendance statistics and patterns.

item.name: Reports
item.description: Generate and access various academic and administrative reports.

item.name: Student Report
item.description: Generate comprehensive report for a specific student including academic performance and attendance.

item.name: Course Report
item.description: Generate detailed report for a specific course including student performance and statistics.

item.name: Semester Report
item.description: Generate overall semester report including all courses and student performance.

item.name: Group Report
item.description: Generate report for a specific group including academic and attendance statistics.

item.name: Messages
item.description: Manage internal messaging and communication.

item.name: List Messages
item.description: View all messages in the inbox.

item.name: Sent Messages
item.description: View all sent messages.

item.name: Received Messages
item.description: View all received messages.

item.name: Unread Count
item.description: Get count of unread messages.

item.name: View Message
item.description: Read a specific message.

item.name: Delete Message
item.description: Remove a message from the system.

item.name: Mark as Read
item.description: Mark a message as read.
